info.title: Registering &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with &rmt;

abstract.para: This guide explains how to register and update &rhel; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with &rmtool; (&rmt;).
To register with &smlm;, see Registering &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with &smlm;.

info.meta: How to use &productname; and &rmt; to update &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber;.
Use &rmt; to update &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber;.

revdescription.para: Changed SUSE Manager to SUSE Multi-Linux Manager where applicable
Changed SUSE Liberty Linux to SUSE Multi-Linux Support where applicable
RMT is now available with all subscription levels
Clarified the tools available with each subscription level
Added more information about default and optional repositories
Updated with changes for new registration script

varlistentry.term: nginx.service is inactive after installing the rmt-server package

listitem.para: Continue the procedure to configure &rmt; in &yast;. This often resolves the issue. If that fails, Apache might be installed on your server, and must be disabled. Apache conflicts with NGINX because both web servers listen on port 80.

varlistentry.term: &productname; does not appear in rmt-cli products list after rmt-cli sync

listitem.para: Check your network. If the network is down, rmt-cli sync fails without showing an error.
If some packages could not be downloaded because of timeouts, rerun the rmt-cli mirror command until all packages are downloaded.

varlistentry.term: Setup script cannot access the &productname; repository

listitem.para: The repodata directory on the &rmt; server will not be available until all of the packages for that repository are downloaded. If some packages could not be downloaded to the &rmt; server because of timeouts during the first mirroring, rerun the rmt-cli mirror command until all packages are downloaded.

varlistentry.term: Setup script cannot install SUSEConnect because of package dependencies

listitem.para: &productname; only supports the latest minor release of &rhla; or CentOS Linux. If your system is running the latest version and SUSEConnect still has package dependency issues, try the following workaround:
Edit the rmt-client-setup-res script to add --skip-broken to the following line:
Run the script and accept any proposed package changes. SUSEConnect will be skipped.
Run the script a second time. The package changes from the first attempt can sometimes resolve the package dependency issues, allowing the second attempt to successfully install SUSEConnect.

varlistentry.term: dnf update fails with Errors during downloading metadata for repository — Status code: 404

listitem.para: The repository shown in the error message might not be mirrored on the &rmt; server. The optional Source and Debug repositories can be enabled with dnf config-manager even if they are not available from &rmt;.
Run dnf repolist all to show the status of the repositories.
If the repository shown in the error message has the status enabled, disable it with the following command:
Run dnf update again to see if the issue is resolved.
If you need the unavailable repository for your system, see .
